model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain sufficient quantity of useful information, enabling the Speaker A to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT. PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY is a summary of the previous dialog, and If the MEMORY contains information that conflicts with the PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY, it is not helpful in that context.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY:
Speaker B is a 26-year-old workaholic who is unsure about their career and doesn't have strong opinions on puppies.
Speaker B is interested in trying different careers and is considering becoming a chef for Speaker A who loves Mexican food and seafood.
Speaker B is interested in becoming a chef but hasn't had the time to apply for jobs.
Speaker B's current job keeps them busy with little free time, affecting their social life.
Speaker B is working on a project to build their resume and is unsure about the type of work they want to do.

CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: A new cat arrived at the shelter. He is very cute, but not cuter than puppies!
Speaker B: Why do you like puppies so much?  What's so different about kittens and puppies?  Aren't they just both babies?  
Speaker A: Yes but puppies are just so cute with their beady eyes and always wagging their tails and following you everywhere!
Speaker B: You have a point.  It is nice to see puppies wagging their tail and just following you!  Changing topics, do you have any recipes with asparagus?  You know, it's such a popular vegetable, but I just don't know how to prepare it.
Speaker A: I don't have recipes but I know how to make a good grilled asparagus. Are you looking to bolster your chef book?
Speaker B: I sure am!  Grilled asparagus does sound good.  Do you pair the grilled asparagus with your fajitas?  What do you prefer, chicken or beef fajitas?
Speaker A: I prefer chicken to beef. I pair it with beef fajitas andI think it's great to have with a glass of merlot. Do you like wine?
Speaker B: You're making me hungry!  Yes, I do love wine.  As a matter of fact, I used to live in the Bordeaux region in France, so my favorite wine is Bordeaux wine.  But I also love champagne and cognac.
Speaker A: Haha, I know right? I lived in the Champagne region for a bit! Always wanted to go to Bordeaux. How was it there?
Speaker B: I didn't know that you also lived in France for a while!  I love French food, especially the bread and fruit pastries.  Living in Bordeaux was fun!  I had the chance to visit all the prehistoric caves with paintings in the Southwest region of France.  Plus, Spain was just a few hours away by train, so I visited Spain quite a few times as well.  Oh, the good old times.  If only I were this excited about my career! 

MEMORY 1:
Speaker A enjoys cooking, especially making fajitas, and also volunteers at animal shelters - (SameTopic) - Speaker A loves animals, especially puppies, and visits shelters in every city they go to.

Speaker A is more interested in science than music, while Speaker B enjoys listening to Black Sabbath and grilling meat - (Want) - Speaker A and Speaker B are excited about the idea of traveling the world and trying different cuisines.

MEMORY 2:
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Introduction and Interests', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B discuss their interests and hobbies.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Hello! How are you? ### Speaker B: I am good, how about you? ### Speaker A: Doing good. I invent things what do you do? ### Speaker B: I'm a workaholic. Do you like music? I like listening to black sabbath. ### Speaker A: I am more into science than music. ### Speaker B: That's interesting. What about your hobbies? ### Speaker A: Mainly I just invent things I like to teleport myself around the world.. ### Speaker B: Cool. I like grilling, because I like eating meat. ### Speaker A: My current project is a time machine. Have you ever traveled in time? ### Speaker B: I haven't. Mainly I just think about how much I have at work. ### Speaker A: What type of work do you do?' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Cooking and Food Preferences', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B share their food preferences and discuss potential collaborations in cooking.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: I prefer mexican food and seafood. Chicken enchiladas, tacos, shrimp shish kabob... Any baked fish. I like it all. If you are going to grill, maybe grilled corn and stuffed burgers ### Speaker B: Ugh that sounds like a plan. Maybe we can teleport around the world and I'll cook different types of cuisines?  ### Speaker A: Oh that would be the best thing ever! I love trying new food! Cooking is a science ya know! ### Speaker B: Ain't that the truth! Do you have any puppies by the way? ### Speaker A: I used to foster puppies, but I am too busy now to deal with them all the time. I do however visit shelters in every city I go to! ### Speaker B: Oh how cool. Are you an animal person? ### Speaker A: Of course! Puppies are my favorite, but dogs are cool too. It is nice to get to meet as many as possible while jumping from place to place. Maybe when I can move through space and time, I can go meet all the puppies from history!! ### Speaker B: But what about the kittens??? ### Speaker A: Have you had any time off for grilling? ### Speaker B: not really yet. I'm hoping I can grill this weekend though.  ### Speaker A: Do you have anything yummy planned out? It's raining here so I may do some indoor grilled veggies for fajitas. :) ### Speaker B: maybe some steaks. need to figure out a good side to go with it. ### Speaker A: Do you like grilled asparagus? I put a little lemon on mine and it's delicious.  ### Speaker B: I've never had it but definitely something to consider.  ### Speaker A: Usually people either really love it or hate it. Have you considered getting a job as a line cook?' }

Explanation: MEMORY 2 is more helpful because it provides context about Speaker A's and B's interests in cooking and food, which aligns with the CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT, where they are discussing recipes and wine preferences. Additionally, MEMORY 2 reveals Speaker A's affinity for animals and volunteering at shelters, which ties back to the start of the current conversation about puppies and an animal shelter. MEMORY 1, while also containing relevant information about preferences for puppies and cooking-related experiences, does not provide as much detail about their food-related interactions which is the current focus of the conversation.
